Article Title: Uttarakhand: Shitalkin Winter Carnival begins in Auli
Article Text: Auli witnessed the inauguration of the Shitalkin Winter Carnival and the National Skiing Championship on Friday.Uttarakhand Minister Satpal Maharaj inaugurated the games by lighting the ceremonial lamp. A total of 17 teams are participating in the Winter Carnival and the National Skiing Championship at the world-famous Auli.More than 300 players are taking part in these Winter Carnival and National Skiing Championship events.Uttarakhand Tourism Minister Satpal Maharaj, while speaking to the reporters, said, "Today, the Winter Carnival is being inaugurated in Auli. I have announced that this carnival will be held every year. We want to make Auli a hub for the Winter Games. We are committed to that. This event will provide employment to the youth. It will boost local entrepreneurs."The Auli Skiing Winter Carnival and National Winter Games Championship 2026 will be held from Feb 13 to 16 at Auli in Chamoli district. National-level competitions in Alpine skiing, snowboarding and ski mountaineering (Skimo) will be held during the four-day event.Perched at 2,500-3,050 m, Auli is one of India's premier skiing spots, boasting long, natural slopes and perfect winter conditions. Auli offers panoramic views of some of India's highest peaks, including the second-highest, Nanda Devi (7,816m).It is also the gateway to the Nanda Devi and the Valley of Flowers National Park, including the Hemkund Sahib gurdwara, and to popular trekking destinations such as Gorson Bugyal, Pangerchulla Summit, and Tapovan.In addition to Auli, Uttarakhand has several other ski destinations, including Dayara Bugyal, Munsiyari, and Mundali.
Article Summary: Uttarakhand Minister Satpal Maharaj inaugurated the games by lighting the ceremonial lamp. A total of 17 teams are participating in the Winter Carnival and the National Skiing Championship. Auli is one of India's premier skiing spots, boasting long, natural slopes and perfect winter conditions.

Article Title: Valentine's Day goal? Married skeleton duo compete for separate nations at Milan Cortina Winter Olympics

Kim Meylemans and Nicole Silveira on their Olympic rivalry



Valentine‚Äôs Day is in the air, but it will look different for Kim Meylemans and Nicole Rocha Silveira. Instead of dinner plans, the married couple will hurtle headfirst down an icy track, chasing Olympic medals for different countries. At the 2026 Milan Cortina Winter Olympics, Belgium‚Äôs Meylemans and Brazil‚Äôs Silveira are competing in the women‚Äôs skeleton event, lining up against each other less than a year after their wedding.After the first two heats, Meylemans sits eighth, 0.84 seconds off the lead. Silveira stands 12th, 1.30 seconds back. Austria‚Äôs Janine Flock leads heading into the final two heats, scheduled for Saturday.A year after marriage, skeleton stars Kim Meylemans and Nicole Silveira meet in Olympic showdown. However, this is not their first Olympic meeting. At the 2022 Beijing Games, Rocha Silveira finished 13th and Kim Meylemans 18th. Meylemans also competed at the 2018 PyeongChang Olympics. Since then, both athletes have grown on the World Cup circuit.Meylemans recently secured Belgium‚Äôs first overall women‚Äôs skeleton World Cup title after medaling in six of seven events this season. Silveira delivered Brazil‚Äôs best ever Olympic sliding result in 2022 and later earned two World Cup bronze medals during the 2024 to 2025 campaign.They met on the Skeleton World Cup tour in 2019. In 2021, they shared their relationship publicly. Silveira proposed in Brazil in 2024, and they married in Calgary in January 2025, where they now live and train.Both athletes describe competition as intense yet grounded in partnership. Meylemans acknowledged her wife‚Äôs role in her success.‚ÄúThis team right here is something truly special though and a big part of this success, I wouldn‚Äôt have achieved this goal without them, especially my wife,‚Äù Meylemans wrote in an Instagram post. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt think anyone truly understands how much I needed her with me (pushing & supporting me) to achieve this.‚ÄùSilveira also shared her thoughts. ‚ÄúProud to be your wife and to walk this walk next to you,‚Äù she commented.Sharing the Olympic stage as rivals is a different experience altogether. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs very special to be able to share Olympic Games with your partner,‚Äù Silveira said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs an extremely stressful, high-pressure period, so to have my person there as a comfort and safe space is of immense value to me, and also my performance. It brings a sense of calmness and normality into the [craziest] weeks of our career.‚ÄùThe couple, however, has a clear Olympic goal. ‚ÄúAt the end of the day, we're working as a team, so if one of us is on the podium, in our small situation then that's great for us,‚Äù Meylemans told Olympics.com last year.Catch their Olympic journey on NBC, Peacock, and NBCOlympics.com, with the third heat at 12 p.m. ET Saturday and the final at 1:35 p.m. ET.

Article Title: What Is the ‚ÄòYear of the Super Bowl‚Äô Campaign? All About ESPN, Disney and the NFL Turning One Game Into 12 Months
Article Text:
ESPN, Disney and the NFL are using ‚ÄúThe Year of the Super Bowl‚Äù to stretch one game into a 12-month content and marketing machine. (Image via Getty)

Inside ESPN‚Äôs ‚ÄòYear of the Super Bowl‚Äô campaign and how it works

Why Disney is pushing ‚ÄòWe‚Äôre Going‚Äô and what brands get out of a year-round Super Bowl

ESPN is not treating its first Super Bowl broadcast as a one-night job. The network, in partnership with the NFL and The Walt Disney Co., has rolled out ‚ÄúThe Year of the Super Bowl,‚Äù a 12-month campaign that started right after Super Bowl 60 and runs through Super Bowl 61 on Feb. 14, 2027, on ESPN and ABC.The push is one of the biggest cross-company projects in ESPN and Disney history, with coordinated programming, park activations and ad inventory built around a single game. It also raises the obvious question: can fans stay locked in on the Super Bowl for an entire year without burning out on the branding?The campaign officially kicked off with ‚ÄúThe Handoff,‚Äù a made-for-TV bridge from this year‚Äôs Super Bowl to next year‚Äôs. Chris Berman appeared from Levi‚Äôs Stadium in Santa Clara, the site of Super Bowl 60, and passed coverage to Scott Van Pelt at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, where Super Bowl 61 will be played.ESPN then turned the moment into a 24-hour activation. Shows like ‚ÄúSportsCenter,‚Äù ‚ÄúSuper Bowl Live,‚Äù ‚ÄúFirst Take‚Äù and ‚ÄúNFL Live‚Äù moved to Disneyland Park in Anaheim, tying NFL coverage directly to Disney‚Äôs theme-park machine.‚ÄúWith the full strength of The Walt Disney Company and in collaboration with the NFL, ESPN has embarked on a year-long Super Bowl celebration,‚Äù ESPN chairman Jimmy Pitaro said.‚ÄúThis fan-focused initiative unites our Company‚Äôs beloved brands with industry-leading storytelling and technology to showcase football‚Äôs greatest stories, heroes, and moments like never before.‚ÄùContent is the backbone of the plan. ESPN has launched ‚ÄúI Scored a Touchdown,‚Äù a weekly short-form series that will highlight 61 players who have scored in the Super Bowl before the 2027 game kicks off. Former New York Giants wide receiver David Tyree, remembered for his helmet catch in Super Bowl XLII, led things off.There is also ‚ÄúThe Biggest Game,‚Äù a weekly video podcast hosted by Jeremy Schaap. The show looks back at six decades of Super Bowl moments, from on-field performances to halftime shows and the off-field storylines that usually spill into the news cycle. The first episode features Berman, who has covered 44 straight Super Bowls.To sell the scale of the project beyond hardcore NFL fans, Disney and ESPN built a separate marketing play: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre Going.‚Äù The spot reimagines the ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to Disney World‚Äù line that Super Bowl champions made famous, this time packing in Disney characters, ESPN faces and ABC personalities all heading to Super Bowl 61.‚ÄúFew phrases are as instantly recognizable in sports as ‚ÄòI‚Äôm going to Disney World,‚Äô‚Äù Asad Ayaz, chief marketing and brand officer of The Walt Disney Co., said. ‚ÄúThis campaign brings together the scale of ESPN, the global power of Disney‚Äôs brands and characters, and the excitement of the Super Bowl to create a shared moment that signals just how big this milestone is for our company and fans.‚Äù‚Äú‚ÄòWe‚Äôre Going‚Äô‚Äù sits on top of a bigger ad play. Disney Advertising plans cross-platform opportunities across ESPN, ABC and other company properties, giving brands a shot at tying into the Super Bowl build-up months before kickoff instead of fighting for 30 seconds in the game.‚Äú‚ÄòWe‚Äôre Going‚Äô is just the beginning of a year-long adventure to our first Super Bowl,‚Äù Tina Thornton, ESPN‚Äôs executive vice president of creative studio and marketing, said. ‚ÄúIt sets the tone for how we‚Äôre approaching Super Bowl LXI, by bringing together the storytelling power of Disney with the scale, voice, and passion of ESPN.‚ÄùOver the 2026-27 NFL season, fans can expect more programming, in-park events and NFL tentpole integrations around the draft and Monday Night Football. ESPN, Disney and the NFL are betting that ‚ÄúThe Year of the Super Bowl‚Äù can keep fans engaged for 12 months and still have something left for kickoff in Los Angeles.
Article Summary: ESPN, Disney and the NFL are using ‚ÄúThe Year of the Super Bowl‚Äù to stretch one game into a 12-month content and marketing machine. The push is one of the biggest cross-company projects in ESPN and Disney history, with coordinated programming, park activations and ad inventory built around a single game.

Article Title: Myles Garrett's Girlfriend Chloe Kim‚Äôs Olympic Dream Over the Years: Revisiting the Gold Streak Behind Her Silver Night
Article Text:
Chloe Kim leaves Milan Cortina with silver instead of a three peat, but her three medal Olympic run still hits harder than most careers. (Image via Getty)

2026: A torn shoulder, a silver medal, and a different kind of win

2018: Chloe Kim turns PyeongChang into a launchpad

2022: Beijing cements the back to back halfpipe champion

Where Chloe Kim sits now in snowboarding history

On a snowy night in Livigno, Italy, Chloe Kim led the women‚Äôs halfpipe final after an 88.00 opener, then watched 17 year old Gaon Choi snatch gold with a 90.25 on her last run. Kim fell on her own final attempt and settled for silver at the 2026 Winter Olympics.This was the shot at a once in a lifetime headline: the first three straight Olympic golds in any snowboarding event. Instead, Kim walks away with three Olympic medals total, two gold and one silver, and remains the only woman with back to back halfpipe titles while Shaun White still stands as the only rider with three golds overall.A month before Milan Cortina, Kim tore the labrum in her left shoulder during training in Switzerland and admitted she was unsure she would even make it to the Games.She still qualified first, then played it safe on her opening run in Livigno, banking that 88.00 while other riders slammed in heavy snow. Choi crashed hard in her first run, needed treatment in the pipe, then came back to land the run of the night and grab gold on her third attempt.Kim had a choice on that last drop: repeat the cleaner, safer first run or throw the hardest combo on her sheet, including the cab double 1080 that has defined her progression.She chose violence. She caught the wall, slid out, and the three peat vanished.Even then, she refused to mope. ‚ÄúIn my eyes, I‚Äôm a winner, because I was able to persevere and fight through,‚Äù she told reporters, per Time. On the way down the hill she walked hand in hand with boyfriend Myles Garrett of the Cleveland Browns, who called watching her ride ‚Äúexciting but terrifying.‚ÄùShe is expected to undergo shoulder surgery once she is back in the United States.Kim did not arrive in PyeongChang as a mystery. She already had X Games golds and had become the first woman to land back to back 1080s in competition.At 17, she turned that hype into something concrete, winning women‚Äôs halfpipe gold with a 93.75, then nearly touching perfection with a 98.25 on her final run. She became the youngest woman to win Olympic snowboarding gold and the youngest to land two 1080s in a row at the Games, jumping past Kelly Clark‚Äôs age record in the process.Four years later in Beijing, Kim arrived with fame, pressure, and time away from the sport behind her. She qualified first, then ended the final early with a 94.00 on her opening run in Genting Snow Park.Her last two attempts turned into lab experiments. She tried new tricks, fell both times, and still won by a margin that made everyone else look like they were fighting for silver. That result made her the first woman ever to win back to back Olympic halfpipe golds.There is still no true three peat in Olympic snowboarding. Kim‚Äôs silver joins failed bids this week from Ester Ledecka in parallel giant slalom and Anna Gasser in big air, both of whom also saw their runs at a third straight gold shut down in Milan Cortina.Kim‚Äôs resume is already in rare air: three Olympic medals, eight X Games golds and a stack of world titles, plus progression tricks like the double cork 1080 and a historic 1260 that moved the entire field‚Äôs ceiling.So yes, the golden three peat story died in the Italian snow. But the bigger picture is ugly for everyone else: even on a torn shoulder, even on a night when a teenager finally beat her, the bar in this sport still has Kim‚Äôs name on it.
Article Summary: Chloe Kim fell on her final run in the women‚Äôs halfpipe final in Milan Cortina, Italy. She was the first woman to win back to back Olympic golds in any snowboarding event. She is expected to undergo shoulder surgery once she is back in the U.S.

Article Title: Almost a year after JPMorgan made 5 days work from office compulsory and CEO Jamie Dimon said don't tell JPMorgan what to do at Townhall; some employees fear petition that they call ‚Äòcareer ...'
Article Text:
When Jamie Dimon's angry outburst at Townhall went viral

In March 2026, it will be a year since America's biggest bank made 5-day work from office compulsory. The largest US bank, which employs more than 300,000 people globally, told all of its employees to return to the office five days a week starting in March, ending a hybrid work-from-home policy that took effect during the pandemic. Just days after CEO Jamie Dimon's order to all employees to come into the office five days a week, a petition surfaced. The petition, which was part of complaints over JP Morgan's call to bring employees back to office 5 days a week, asked CEO Dimon to reverse the change. The petition that continues to be live online is addressed to chairman and CEO Jamie Dimon. In the petition, employees have complained about losing hybrid working arrangements. "Some employees sought advice from the Communications Workers of America on how they might set up a labor union, a rare thing in the US finance sector.And now a year since the petition was set up, it has about 2,000 signatories out of the Bank's more than 300,000 global employees. According to a report in Financial Times, there are some who believe that signing the petition will be a ‚Äòcareer suicide‚Äô. The report details internal backlash to the 5-day mandate.As per the report, employees at the America's largest lender told the Financial Times they were bewildered by management‚Äôs insistence on a full-time return to company offices, though teams are scattered across the globe. ‚ÄúMy team is spread out through two continents and three time zones,‚Äù said a JPMorgan employee who signed a petition to bring back hybrid work. ‚ÄúJPMorgan is a global company ‚Äî why can‚Äôt that include my home office?‚Äù ‚ÄúHybrid is working and employees love the happy medium,‚Äù the staffer told the FT. "We, the workers of JPMorganChase (JPMC), are concerned about the future of our workplace - its integrity, employee satisfaction, and the increasing toxicity that has metastasized in our company culture in the last couple of months," reads the petition.Dimon announced the five-day return to office policy on January 10, 2025, ahead of a March 2025 start date. Soon after announcing the change, Dimon went viral for angry outburst he had about the employee petition during a Town Hall meeting. When asked about the in-person work policy during the staff meeting, he said, "Don't waste time on it. I don't care how many people sign that fucking petition," he said, drawing some laughter. Instead, Dimon demanded more efficiency and stressed employees have a choice whether to work at JPMorgan. The CEO told them not to be mad at him, and said it was a free country.Dimon, who has run the lender for 19 years, said some staff did not pay attention during Zoom meetings, which reduced their efficiency and creativity. In-office requirements will not be left up to managers, Dimon said. "There is no chance that I will leave it up to managers," he said. "Zero chance. The abuse that took place is extraordinary."In an interview to CNBC, Dimon said, that he respects employees who don't want to come into the office five days a week, but said the policy will not change because it is best for clients and the company. "I am not against working from home, I am against where it doesn't work," he said, adding that 10% of the bank's jobs are done remotely.Later in the year, in an interview to Bloomberg, Dimon said that he also understands the appeal of logging in from home; remote work can pan out well for some companies and certain roles. Talking about his angry response to a question on work from home, he said, ‚ÄúI gave a very detailed answer about why [work from home] doesn‚Äôt work for young people, why it doesn‚Äôt work for management, why it doesn‚Äôt work for innovation,‚Äù Dimon said. ‚ÄúI completely applaud your right to not want to go to the office every day. But you‚Äôre not going to tell JPMorgan what to do.‚Äù
Article Summary: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon ordered all employees to return to the office five days a week starting in March 2025. Dimon announced the 5-day return to office policy on January 10, 2025, ahead of a March 2025 start date. Just days after the announcement, a petition surfaced asking Dimon to reverse the change. The petition has about 2,000 signatories out of the Bank's more than 300,000 global employees.

Article Title: Mahbubnagar municipal corporation election result 2026: Congress takes early lead in Devarakadra; BJP trails
Article Text:
Hyderabad: Rs 262 Cr Compensation After Tragedy, ATM Cash Heist, Footpath Crackdown And More

HYDERABAD: Counting for the Telangana Municipal Corporation elections is underway across more than 116 municipalities and seven corporations, following voting on Wednesday.The Congress party has taken an early lead in the two municipalities of Mahabubnagar district in the Telangana 2026 municipal election results.In Devarakadra municipality, which has 12 wards, Congress has secured 6 wards, the Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) has won 4, the BJP 1, and 1 ward went to an independent candidate.On Wednesday, elections were held across seven Municipal Corporations and 116 Municipalities in Telangana, covering 414 wards in the corporations of Kothagudem, Karimnagar, Mahabubnagar, Mancherial, Nizamabad, Nalgonda, and Ramagundam, and 2,582 wards in the 116 municipalities.The Telangana Municipal Election was held peacefully with over 73 per cent of voters exercising their franchise on Wednesday in the municipal elections, which passed off well, barring minor skirmishes at a few places.Earlier on Wednesday, Telangana BJP President N. Ramchander Rao expressed confidence that the party would win a significant number of seats, saying the people of Telangana were likely to give a "big mandate" to the Bharatiya Janata Party.Rao said, "Last time we had around 330 municipal councillors and corporators and three chairmen. But this time, I am sure the people of Telangana will give a big mandate to the Bharatiya Janata Party. We are hopeful that we will fare better and we will be the alternative to the Congress party."
Article Summary: The Congress party has taken an early lead in the two municipalities of Mahabubnagar district in the Telangana 2026 municipal election results. In Devarakadra municipality, which has 12 wards, Congress has secured 6 wards, the Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) has won 4, the BJP 1, and 1 ward went to an independent candidate.
